page.title: 11ARTS AND CRAFTS.
page.content: Someone had the bright idea of inviting talented craftsmen and women to demonstrate their skills at the park centre for four consecutive Sundays at a time. This has proved to be very popular. The crafts demonstrated are water-colour painting by a local artist, John Forgan. Paul Boyle, Val Corry and John Malone show how to make pottery. Wood carving is the work of John Donaldson. One artist, Dave Hickman, uses things found in the woods to produce relief printing.The local deer are used as models for acrylic painting by William Ramsay. Two other skills, decorated furniture and corn dolls, are taught by David Rickard and Frank Cooper. Pyrography,or poker-work, is beautifully done by Helen Bisset.
